http://www.nielit.gov.in/content/digital-literacy-courses
http://www.nielit.gov.in/content/short-term-courses-software

They have training centres in several locations. Do take a look, and pass it on to interested students.

Computer Tally class on GST For My Quest skills to succeed students by Mr.Basavana Gouda
Hello,today we are conducted FIRST ALUMINI MEET-2018,i am realy thank quest alience to aupport us,thank you so much..

Here's a question

What do you do when an ITI student tells you she or he wants to **quit the course**? What are the steps you take?

Yesterday we invited **alumni **who are looking for jobs to a Interview prep session. We had more than **80 girls** come together to learn about job profiles, have a re-look at their resumes and do some mock interviews. 

How do you **feel** while listening to what **Farheen **has to say? Are there any **quick initiatives** you can run for your un-placed alumni?

Digital job fair.

HireMee is a web portal that aims to ensure that bright young graduates from colleges across India are discovered by companies. Colleges can also improve their placement records using this portal.

HireMee provides a mobile app that allows students to upload video profiles for a more personal touch to their resumes and also conducts skill assessments that are put together by experts in each domain and award students with a 7-digit score that goes into their pre-assessed profiles. This combination of a pre-assessed resume, a skill assessment test and video profile gives companies and recruiters a comprehensive idea of each candidate. They can shortlist candidates based on their requirements directly from HireMee website or mobile app.

Helping students find their dream job and creating great job openings for freshers, companies find the right employees and helping colleges ensure better placement records is the objective. HireMee services are completely free and are aimed towards ensuring students from all over India get a chance to find their dream job.

This shocking survey report might or might not have made any difference to concern Education & school Authorities but the students by and large have become the victims, made to face the bitter consequences of their own uncertain futures. data.message: My career "I am " activity .

DON'T READ 
Viktor Frankl, one of the great psychiatrists of the twentieth century, survived the death camps of Nazi Germany. 
His little book, Man’s Search for Meaning, is one of those life-changing books that everyone should read.
Frankl once told the story of a woman who called him in the middle of the night to calmly inform him she was about to commit suicide.
Frankl kept her on the phone and talked her through her depression, giving her reason after reason to carry on living. 
Finally she promised she would not take her life, and she kept her word.
When they later met, Frankl asked which reason had persuaded her to live?
"None of them", she told him.
What then influenced her to go on living, he pressed?
Her answer was simple, it was Frankl’s *willingness to listen* to her in the middle of the night. 
A world in which there was someone ready to listen to another's pain seemed to her a world in which it was worthwhile to live.
Often, it is not the brilliant argument that makes the difference. 
Sometimes the *small act of listening* is the greatest gift we can give.

# 90 Women ITI students from Annai ITI, Erode, Tamil Nadu recently underwent a 2 day workshop on Self-employment where they learnt making jewellery using Terracotta. The  objectives of the workshop are mentioned below:  
# 1) To develop a clear understanding of Self employment as a viable livelihood alternative for ITI students. 
# 2) To understand basic concepts of demand and supply , market, customer, quality  and marketing

It is heartening to see when Govt functionaries, teachers, students and organisations come together for one common goal - Help young students reach their dreams! 

Principal of Pragathi ITI - "Our timeline and curriculum is strict and teachers too sometimes get used to the routine. I'm thankful to Quest Alliance for always thinking about our students and bringing these new programs to us. Self employment is really helpful for us because of our remote location."

What is the dream?
Principal - To make Pragathi a model ITI
Teachers - To become better facilitators
Students - To be their own boss and earn money!

data.message:
# **#9 Startup Essentials**
# **Confirmation Bias**

**Confirmation Bias **is the tendency to search for, interpret, favor, and recall information in a way that confirms one's preexisting beliefs or hypotheses. 

This video explains the basis of **Confirmation Bias**. 

**I am open to your Questions for Discussions.**

Do Mention in the comment Section.

**With Amazing Groups**

[Communicative English](https://questalliance.facebook.com/groups/2076064505946695/) [Entrepreneurship](https://questalliance.facebook.com/groups/166971703871481/) [Life Skills](https://questalliance.facebook.com/groups/148774729037763/) [My Career](https://questalliance.facebook.com/groups/112376982763245/) [Digital Literacy](https://questalliance.facebook.com/groups/853886414784948/) [Resource Library](https://questalliance.facebook.com/groups/112373509463067/)

# **#8 Startup Essentials**
# **Disruptive Innovation**

The term of art coined by **Clayton Christensen**, describes a process by which **a product or service** takes root initially in **simple applications at the bottom** of a market and then **relentlessly moves up market**, eventually displacing established competitors.

This video explains how Disruptive Innovation works. 

**I am open to your Questions for Discussions.**

**Tips for aspiring entrepreneurs**

 

If you're ready to enter the world of entrepreneurship, here are five important tips from experts to keep in mind.

**Learn from others' failures.** Rather than admiring the small percentage of businesses that grow to become successful, study those that end up failing. Gottlieb said this research would greatly increase your chances of success, because most companies have made common mistakes that have led to their demise. He said that having the humility to learn from the mistakes of others before making them yourself is the secret to success.

**Make sure this is what you want.** Because entrepreneurship entails so much hard work, it is critical to ensure you're following the right path,

"If this is something you really want, then think long term, and be persistent," she said. "The vast majority of great entrepreneurs failed multiple times before they finally found the business idea that took off and brought them success."

**Solve problems.** Entrepreneurs should always be in search of problems to solve and not the other way around, . In other words, "they should not start with a solution looking for a problem," he said.

**Be passionate.** Successful entrepreneurs are driven primarily by a need for achievement and the desire to make a meaningful difference, Bachenheimer said. "The most important traits are passion and persistence, but these must not be confused with arrogance and stubbornness," he said.

**Get advice from those who have done it.**  business owners to find mentors who are successful, in addition to reading books, networking with people they admire and looking into great education programs to help them throughout the process.

# **#4 Startup Essentials**
# **The Lean Methodology**

 It is an approach to** running an organization** that supports the concept of **continuous improvement, a long-term approach** to work that systematically seeks to ***achieve small, incremental changes in processes*** in order to improve efficiency and quality.

# **#3 Startup Essentials**
# **Minimum Viable Product**

It is a development technique in which a new **product** or **website is developed** with ***sufficient features to satisfy early adopters.*** The final, complete set of features is only designed and developed **after considering feedback **from the **product's** initial users.

**WORD OF THE WEEK: Ecosystem **

MEANING
* includes all of the living things (plants, animals and organisms) in a given area, interacting with each other, and also with their non-living environments (weather, earth, sun, soil, climate, atmosphere) 
* a complex network or interconnected system  
## *What are the different ecosystems that exist in your home town and how are they different from each other? *

**WORD OF THE WEEK: BLEND **

**MEANING**

**mix (a substance) with another substance so that they combine together. **

Eg - blend a teaspoon of sugar with lime juice to make sweet lime juice.   

**a mixture of different substances or other things. **

Eg -  Purple is a blend of red and blue.
